suite.name: Tests

kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using `dbName`, `dbUsername`, and `dbPassword`.
kw.msg: Connecting using : pymssql.connect(database=AdventureWorks2012, user=test_user, password=test_user, host=EPPLWARW01DC\SQLEXPRESS, port=1433)

test.name: Verify the count of records in [Person].[Address] table

kw.name: Query
kw.doc: Uses the input `selectStatement` to query for the values that will be returned as a list of tuples. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback. Set optional input `returnAsDict` to True to return values as a list of dictionaries.
kw.msg: Executing : Query | SELECT COUNT(*) AS count_rows FROM [Person].[Address];

kw.name: Should Not Be Empty
kw.doc: Verifies that the given item is not empty.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

test.doc: | *Setup*: | 0.Connect To Database AdventureWorks2012 via pymsql | | *Test Steps* | 0.Query row count for Table Person.Address | | *Expected result:* | 0.Result is not empty | 1.The value with the total number of records in the [Person].[Address] table is the same as expected

test.name: Verify the number of unique cities in [Person].[Address] table

kw.name: Query
kw.doc: Uses the input `selectStatement` to query for the values that will be returned as a list of tuples. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback. Set optional input `returnAsDict` to True to return values as a list of dictionaries.
kw.msg: Executing : Query | SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT [City]) AS count_cities FROM [Person].[Address];

kw.name: Should Not Be Empty
kw.doc: Verifies that the given item is not empty.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

test.doc: | *Setup*: | 0.Connect To Database AdventureWorks2012 via pymsql | | *Test Steps* | 0.Query to calculate number of unique cities in [Person].[Address] table | | *Expected result:* | 0.Result is not empty | 1.The total number unique cities in the [Person].[Address] table is the same as expected

test.name: Verify the average length of the documents in [Production].[Document] table

kw.name: Query
kw.doc: Uses the input `selectStatement` to query for the values that will be returned as a list of tuples. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback. Set optional input `returnAsDict` to True to return values as a list of dictionaries.
kw.msg: Executing : Query | SELECT AVG(LEN([Document])) AS avg_lenght FROM [Production].[Document];

kw.name: Should Not Be Empty
kw.doc: Verifies that the given item is not empty.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

test.doc: | *Setup*: | 0.Connect To Database AdventureWorks2012 via pymsql | | *Test Steps* | 0.Query to calculate average length of the documents in [Production].[Document] table | | *Expected result:* | 0.Result is not empty | 1. Average value of length of [Document] in [Production].[Document] table is the same as expected

test.name: Verify the possible values of [Status] attribute in [Production].[Document] table

kw.name: Query
kw.doc: Uses the input `selectStatement` to query for the values that will be returned as a list of tuples. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback. Set optional input `returnAsDict` to True to return values as a list of dictionaries.
kw.msg: Executing : Query | SELECT COUNT ([Status]) AS count_values FROM [Production].[Document] WHERE [STATUS] <1 OR [STATUS]>3;

kw.name: Should Not Be Empty
kw.doc: Verifies that the given item is not empty.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

test.doc: | *Setup*: | 0.Connect To Database AdventureWorks2012 via pymsql | | *Test Steps* | 0.Query to calculate count of rows with incorrect [Status]. | | *Expected result:* | 0.Result is not empty | 1. Count of rows with incorrect [Status] is the same as expected: 0

test.name: Verify the maximum value of the [ModifiedDate] column in [Production].[UnitMeasure] table

kw.name: Query
kw.doc: Uses the input `selectStatement` to query for the values that will be returned as a list of tuples. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback. Set optional input `returnAsDict` to True to return values as a list of dictionaries.
kw.msg: Executing : Query | SELECT MAX([ModifiedDate]) as max_date FROM [Production].[UnitMeasure];

kw.name: Should Not Be Empty
kw.doc: Verifies that the given item is not empty.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Strings
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to strings.

test.doc: | *Setup*: | 0.Connect To Database AdventureWorks2012 via pymsql | | *Test Steps* | 0.Query to calculate the maximum value of the [ModifiedDate] column in [Production].[UnitMeasure] table. | | *Expected result:* | 0.Result is not empty | 1. The maximum value of the [ModifiedDate] column in [Production].[UnitMeasure] table is the same as expected.

test.name: Verify the numbers of rows in [Production].[UnitMeasure] table with [UnitMeasureCode] with only one symbol

kw.name: Query
kw.doc: Uses the input `selectStatement` to query for the values that will be returned as a list of tuples. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback. Set optional input `returnAsDict` to True to return values as a list of dictionaries.
kw.msg: Executing : Query | SELECT COUNT(*) AS count_values FROM [Production].[UnitMeasure] WHERE LEN([UnitMeasureCode])=1;

kw.name: Should Not Be Empty
kw.doc: Verifies that the given item is not empty.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Strings
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to strings.

test.doc: | *Setup*: | 0.Connect To Database AdventureWorks2012 via pymsql | | *Test Steps* | 0.Query to calculate numbers of rows in [Production].[UnitMeasure] table with [UnitMeasureCode] with only one symbol. | | *Expected result:* | 0.Result is not empty | 1.Numbers of rows in [Production].[UnitMeasure] table with [UnitMeasureCode] with only one symbol is the same as expected.
